page.title: 11Housing in Gwyddelwern
page.content: The Gwyddelwern area is fortunate as it does not have major housing problems. There are many different types of dwellings, large{farm houses,}some over 150 years old built mostly of Welsh stone, with slated roofs. The majority have been modernised and repaired with the help of Local Authority Grants. Smaller houses have also benefited from bathrooms installed. New{modern houses}and{bungalows}are on the increase, and some are still under construction. There are a large proportion of {Council owned houses}& flats, 2 & 3 bedroom, the rents of these are around Â£20 - Â£25 per week. The tenants do not change often and many have bought them. Mrs E. Westcott.
